text:
yea it’s on my radar see <#CBBAW6Z3R|community-browser-extension>
A feature that is disabled required additional permissions. There is nothing taking advantage of the permissions right now.

I plan to get that resolved this week. just have not had a chance yet.

The additional permission slipped in with an update I made that fixed a ton of bugs and brought beta and stable channel up to parity.

Intent is not to ever request that permission but make it optional, and make it so that if you do not use that permission you can grant a permission on an individual site basis. For context this is related to a feature that grabs developer info for the current page, so you can use that information easier
unfortunately Google’s testing mechanism doesn’t present those permissions requests reliably otherwise it would have been caught before release
I really wish HubSpot CRM allowed bulk delete/assign etc in the Conversations Inbox.
when safari supports the standards for web extensions

that or someone passionate about safari adds support in.

We have a similar drive for people wanting Firefox support. would love to support it, just don’t have the personal bandwidth, need someone to help port it.
I would help if I could but I’m just a designer who learned a bit of front end :disappointed:
as long as you know html, css, or js you are able to work on chrome extensions - they are built with the same technology. just with some extra APIs specific to extensions
